(6 - NKA Report)
Note the X's on the chart* They are marked in those ceils
in which we believe that a specific method of dealing with a
specific area of content will achieve a specific goal* If we do
this sort of analysis carefully enough, and if we are at all
imaginative in thinking of the best possible methods for achieving
our goals, we will be in a better position to start thinking about
the possible media and the best media for carrying out these methods
in a particular area* It is at this point that we should consider
the relative advantages of television, radio, films, field trips,
and so forth - and not before* It is at this point also that we
snould consider the practicality of the methods which have been
thought of. If we are considering the education of children in
many raid-west towns, it is probably not possible for them to talk
to Spanish children in person or to see live Spanish dances* Per¬
haps here is a place to use television or film; *1111 these do the
same job? Axe they better than other methods which might be employed
in such communities to foster feelings of wonderment or to stimulate
intellectual curiosity? tfe are now coming closer to defining re-
searchable questions* If the analyses have been carefully carried
out, good educational questions are bound to be generated because
we then know the dimensions of our problem and the content, methods,
goals, and media to be investigated* By knowing the specific con¬
tent and the methods which are to achieve each goal, refinement of
testing procedures is made possible*
